content: I just had to shell out $200.00 to have my septic tank cleaned. It hasn't been cleaned in 15 years. The man told me that it was really bad and he even looked a little green around the gills. He said I should have it cleaned every 3 or 4 years. Is he right?

content: Pump it into another holding tank that you can control the temperature on and then take the gaseous vapor from that to reheat the holding tank. Any leftover gas is usable for the hot water heater and the pool heater. Add lime and stir to create more gas quicker. Add friends to use the toilet to get more effluence to make more gas. Have a party to make more gas. Open a gas station with free toilets. Open a burrito stand that specializes in Olestra cooking oil fried products. Add laxative to drinks sold at a slightly cheaper price. Have fun. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

content: We had our septic tank pumped about 3 years ago. The pumper guy said if there is just the two of us, 7-8 years would would be ok. I asked if there were 4 of us, he said, about 3 years. Re. Ridex, I talked to the engineer who designed our system, he said, "you are wasting your money, you don't need it". The county had a seminar on septic tanks, the county engineer said, "Ridex is not needed". BTW. the engineer who designed our system, said, "if you want, you can flush some yeast down the toilet once in a while." Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
reply: We had our septic tank pumped about 3 years ago. The pumper guy said if there is just the two of us, 7-8 years would would be ok. I asked if there were 4 of us, he said, about 3 years. Re. content: quote: Originally posted by Bergy46: BTW. the engineer who designed our system, said, "if you want, you can flush some yeast down the toilet once in a while." Yea I was told that 20 yrs ago by an old timer.He said to pour about a cup of sugar in your toilet bowl. Drop in a packet of regular bread yeast. Stir with your toilet brush until the sugar dissolves. give it a couple of minutes for the yeast to activate ( eating the sugar ) and flush. He reccommended to do this 3 times a year Spring, Summer, and Fall
quote: Originally posted by Bergy46: BTW. the engineer who designed our system, said, "if you want, you can flush some yeast down the toilet once in a while."

title: How often should you have your Septic tank cleaned?

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I just had to shell out $200.00 to have my septic tank cleaned. It hasn't been cleaned in 15 years. The man told me that it was really bad and he even looked a little green around the gills. He said I should have it cleaned every 3 or 4 years. Is he right? There are a lot of factors concerning that. How well does your soil perk? How large is your tank? Do you have a leech field or a dry well? Are you very careful about not letting grease go down your drain? Do you live in a warm part of the country or a cold part. How many males/females in your household? {Yes it matters} Do you do laundry frequently? Do you run the dishwasher frequently? Do you have a garbage grinder? That being said, best thing to do is keep an eye on it. If you live in a warm part of the country the access will only be a few inches underground. "http://www.lcra.org/featurestory/2006/septic_sense.html" "http://www.rd.com/19440/article19440.html" "http://www.soil.ncsu.edu/publications/Soilfacts/AG-439-22/" How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I just had to shell out $200.00 to have my septic tank cleaned. It hasn't been cleaned in 15 years. The man told me that it was really bad and he even looked a little green around the gills. He said I should have it cleaned every 3 or 4 years. Is he right?
reply: There are a lot of factors concerning that. How well does your soil perk? How large is your tank? Do you have a leech field or a dry well? Are you very careful about not letting grease go down your drain? Do you live in a warm part of the country or a cold part. How many males/females in your household? {Yes it matters} Do you do laundry frequently? Do you run the dishwasher frequently? Do you have a garbage grinder? That being said, best thing to do is keep an eye on it. If you live in a warm part of the country the access will only be a few inches underground. "http://www.lcra.org/featurestory/2006/septic_sense.html" "http://www.rd.com/19440/article19440.html" "http://www.soil.ncsu.edu/publications/Soilfacts/AG-439-22/" How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
